text.p: Connecticut Attorney General Richard Blumenthal said Thursday that a landmark deal to resolve tobacco-related lawsuits could be only hours away.
Blumenthal said on local radio that an agreement with the U.S. tobacco industry could be close, even though there were still two main areas of disagreement.

"One, details as to the terms of any final settlement protecting public health, and then larger issues relating to assuring that people's rights are protected to sue the industry for the harm that's done," Blumenthal told WTIC-AM radio.

A total of 38 states have sued cigarette makers to recoup the health care costs of treating sick smokers. The negotiations have been pressured by the fact that the first trial of a state Medicaid suit is set to begin in Mississippi on July 7.
"We're very optimistic. We hope to present (today) an agreement in principal to the White House...," Massachusetts Attorney General Scott Harshbarger told local WBZ-AM radio Thursday.
